text: Early Access ProgramIntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 Beta Is Out! The Beta version of IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 is now available with all the key improvements and new features coming in the major release.  You can download the latest build from our website, from the free Toolbox App, or by using snaps for Ubuntu. Download IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 Beta To see the most notable updates from this development cycle, check out our blog posts tagged with IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP. Here’s a short summary of what you’ll find:  Logical code structure in the Structure tool window  Improved application debugging in Kubernetes Cluster-wide Kubernetes log access Stable Kotlin K2 mode  AI Assistant updates  Expanded Docker Compose support Improved workflows with Dev Containers Enhanced terminal experience Updates for OpenTofu and Terraform Better integration with version control systems New features for debugging and profiling applications Multiple UI/UX improvements across the IDE For the full list of changes implemented in this build, refer to the release notes. As we finalize everything for the major release, you still have a few weeks to try out these features and help us refine the final version. html:
Early Access Program

IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 Beta Is Out!

The Beta version of IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 is now available with all the key improvements and new features coming in the major release. 

You can download the latest build from our website, from the free Toolbox App, or by using snaps for Ubuntu.

Download IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 Beta

To see the most notable updates from this development cycle, check out our blog posts tagged with IntelliJ IDEA 2024.3 EAP. Here’s a short summary of what you’ll find: 

  • Logical code structure in the Structure tool window 
  • Improved application debugging in Kubernetes
  • Cluster-wide Kubernetes log access
  • Stable Kotlin K2 mode 
  • AI Assistant updates 
  • Expanded Docker Compose support
  • Improved workflows with Dev Containers
  • Enhanced terminal experience
  • Updates for OpenTofu and Terraform
  • Better integration with version control systems
  • New features for debugging and profiling applications
  • Multiple UI/UX improvements across the IDE

For the full list of changes implemented in this build, refer to the release notes.

As we finalize everything for the major release, you still have a few weeks to try out these features and help us refine the final version. Share your feedback in the comments, on X, or by submitting any issues to our tracker.

Happy developing!
